basics.name: Emillia E. Noordhoek
basics.summary: 'I'm a seasoned business development professional on a mission to help an early stage green startup profit and thrive

work.summary: Helping to strengthen and launch community-driven and volunteer-powered projects, develop, adopt meaningful community engagement strategies, and harness the power of the social web for social good. This work is guided by 13 years of prior experience working with community-based economic, environmental and energy initiatives in the Hawaiian Islands
highlights: Consulting and stewarding emergency funding applications for green startups and non-profits in current COVID19 crisis on available Small Business Association (SBA)emergency financial products
Developed the content and evaluated outcomes with varying communications channels of key stakeholders invovled with the successful outcomes of the Community Renewable Energy Project.
Co-founded the Tentou Network a green business consortium  of global leaders following in the footsteps of 100% Renewbale Energy Samso Island, Denmark.

work.summary: Built a financially, sustainble organization from the ground up through creative fundraising, grantwriting, and donor development, increased the annual budget 100% to $1,000,000.00 annually  by the end of my tenor
highlights: Pioneered sustianable financial models for Hawaii tourists to offset carbon footprint for travel.

Executed daily organizational operations including: annual budget, program implementation;community relations and organizing; program evaluation; staff and management of 6-10 team members, 30 plus volunteers.
Identified industry trends and shifts. Adjusted to acquire growth while retaining our organizational values.
Collaborated with and nutured partnerships with high net worth donors.
Secured $9.6 million in public financing through the Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority to provide revolving loans for 1,200 homes to participate in a solar programs.

work.summary: Capitilized on the mission to build sustianable affordable housing by forming new business and brand partnerships, increasing annual budget to < $1.5 million
highlights: Coordinated project feasibility, developed and managed project budgets, secured $1.2 million in project financing from private and public sources pivoting focus to energy efficiency and solar.
Underwrote 15- 30 year mortgage at 0% interest that were held by local affilate for the life of the loan.
Developed, Coordniated, Monitered and Evaluated all aspects of the Global Village Program into a viabrant and dynmic, growing income stream generating well over $100,000 USD annually.
Founding architect of community based art center, developed sustainable finanical infrastructure, art and residency programs, and dynamic annual fundraisers.

awards.summary: The core of HAPA’s mission is to catalyze community empowerment and systemic change - a change that goes to the root of our social, economic and environmental injustices.

Most recently built an expertise in small business and non-profit revolving loan products specifically for renewable energy and climate mitigation projects.
